fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: The Student Services is here to support you. Reach out to us on our social media anytime if you have a question and we will get back to you as soon as we can.

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: You can join the International Student Visa team's online sessions to  ask any question on your visas and immigration issues every Tuesday and Friday, 2-4 pm. Click here to join: http://ow.ly/BFwv50z8AlE

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: Working at a computer often involves few changes in body position leading to muscular aches and pains. Posturite is sharing some stretching and exercises that you can do at your desk. http://ow.ly/fdN050yZIoS

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: Our student adviser is here to advice you on your studies and student life today on your appointments from 1-4 pm. They can also refer you to any relevant service if needed.

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: Organizing your life and getting into the routine are some of the tips if you are in self-isolation. Check out for more practical expert survival tips for students: http://ow.ly/1CzL50z8ARy

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: @CityUniCareers is running a series of Webinar for SASS students on how to write effective CVs and cover letters, as well as how to develop your networking skills from Thursday 16 April through to May. Book your place on Careershub  http://ow.ly/ARuS50z8Az3

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: If your Tier 4 Student visas are due to expire and you cannot leave the UK due to travel restrictions, contact the Home Office or City's Coronavirus Immigration Team for support and information on visa extensions: http://ow.ly/Jo0P50z8zYH

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: Mind is providing useful tips how to maintain your physical health and mental wellbeing during the coronavirus pandemic. http://ow.ly/tSHQ50yZID9

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: The Student Health Services is committed to help you look after your health and well-being.  Our Nurse Adviser is available for health related consultations from Monday - Friday, 1-4 PM.

fullName: City, University of London Student Centre
text: The Academic Learning Support webinar is coming up this afternoon at 3-4 PM to help you with studying at home, managing your time and staying healthy: http://ow.ly/vV9k50z7qVc

students with securing top finance roles.

Looking to destress? City's Centre for Excellence in Mindfulness Research (CEMR) is hosting regularly lunchtime check-ins and meditation every Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 12:30 (BST) on Microsoft Teams. Find links to the sessions here: http://ow.ly/qKvQ50z8Pdc #Mindfulness

The application deadline for our online MSc Global Finance programme is 26 April. The course is designed for highly driven, motivated finance professionals looking to further their career without having to interrupt work or personal commitments: https://hubs.ly/H0pbZb60 #Finance

Are you a busy executive looking to study a PhD? Our Executive PhD may be your answer. Join our next online information session on 24th April 13:00-14:00 UK time to find out more. Sign up now: http://ow.ly/88rr50yK4nj

Self-isolation entertainment tips: The National Theatre is releasing a number of plays to watch for free every Thursday, available to stream on YouTube for a week. This week, watch Jane Eyre: http://ow.ly/ujNJ50z8LXo

Our colleagues over at CitySport are helping students and staff stay active during the lockdown with daily videos, challenges and online classes. Go check out their page for fitness motivation: CitySport üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è#WeAreTogether

Cass students, such as Josef Jackon (MSc Finance, 2019) have been earning sought-after positions in the finance sector with help from the online training and recruitment stimulation platform Amplify Trading, launched by a City alumna. He says, "The first time I worked with Amplify was during a trading simulation. It really helped to cultivate my skillset." He now works as an Analyst at Morgan Stanley. #ConnectingCass #Finance http://ow.ly/TEUY50z8I7f

"The strength of the alumni network has proven true: in both my current job and my previous job, I was hired by alumni of the programme! Today, I work as an investment analyst," says Souren Gharnagharian, MSc Shipping, Trade and Finance (2017). #Shipping #Trade #Finance #MSc #Masters #Cass #CassAlumni  http://ow.ly/2fKp50z7AQO

City alumn Steve Mills (Aeronautical Engineering, 1971) book The Dawn of the Drone: From the Back Room Boys of World War One explores the prototype weapons stemmed from an early form of television demonstrated before the war by Prof. A. M. Low. Steve's book includes the association with Northampton College and the University of Handley Page, Tom Vincent Smith and Prof. Tokaty. 

Purchase the book here - https://amzn.to/3eblqFB

The World's Oldest Man and a former City, University of London staff Bob Weighton has lived through a global pandemic before - the Spanish flu. Bob is now offering an interesting point of view to the current Covid-19 situation as he self-isolates in his assisted living home.
https://bit.ly/2Uzge6J

This week, Penguin Press will publish 'Feeding Britain, Our Food Problems and How to Fix Them' authored by Professor Tim Lang, Centre for Food Policy at City.
https://bit.ly/2Js7qtd

Please be aware! If you have the City, University of London alumni card, the University has closed most of its buildings starting this week, disabling access to libraries. We hope for your understanding during these unusual times and will announce any changes to this decision immediately.

Latest University Covid-19 information - https://bit.ly/3bilKA5

üí° Academics at our School of Health Sciences (City Health Sciences) are collaborating with colleagues at The Royal Marsden NHS Foundation Trust and Institute of Cancer Research (ICR) on a new ¬£3 million, eight-year long study funded by NIHR (National Institute for Health Research).

The City academics will work on the health economics aspect of the study, to investigate how cost-effective a new diagnostic blood test for residual, microscopic bowel cancer may be üîç
